Job Description:
LanguageLine Solutions is Hiring!
At LanguageLine, we strive for a world in which language and cultural barriers no longer exist. Use your language skills to dramatically improve the lives of limited-English speakers, as well as the Deaf and Hard-of-Hearing. Even better, you can do this while working from your own home.

You'll also be supported by a Senior Language Specialist, as well as our Interpreter and Technology Help Desks.

INTERPRETERS - VIDEO-REMOTE INTERPRETERS (VRI): Our Video-Remote (VRI) Interpreters are paramount to the success of our company. Applicants need to have appropriate education and work experience. With our continued growth across the country and internationally, we are seeking interpreters who can service ANY of our Language Needs. If you believe you possess the required skills, and qualifications, please apply below!

In order to interpret communications, an Interpreter performs many different tasks.

Translate Verbal Communications
The bulk of an Interpreters' job is to translate verbal communications, usually in real-time. This can include speeches at conferences and events, meetings, classes and training sessions, or individual communications between two people or small groups of people. It is crucial that they interpret accurately and quickly in real-time without leaving out or changing any information that is being communicated.

Translate Written Communications
Interpreters also translate written communications. These can include anything from documents and forms to meeting notes to emails to presentations. It’s important that they effectively communicate the meaning of the text and maintain its core message.

Assist Clients
Acting as a liaison between two parties, the interpreters facilitate communications by assisting clients on behalf of their company. This can include helping them understand documents and information given out by the company, assisting them in filling out forms and paperwork, and answering questions or addressing concerns on behalf of the client. They must also maintain a knowledge of the clients’ culture and be aware of any culturally sensitive issues that may arise.

Record Interactions
The Interpreter is often required to document and record interactions and translations. They record their interactions by entering data into a system, and that information is then used for various statistical reporting purposes. This includes recording in-person interactions as well as phone conversations and taking meeting minutes.

Interpreting Skills
Since communication is the job of an Interpreter, they must have fantastic communication abilities, verbal and written, in both of the languages, they will be using. They are personable and have great relationship-building skills, allowing them to effectively communicate and build relationships with both parties. Empathy and an awareness of other cultures are also crucial to being a successful Interpreter.

Based on job listings we looked at, employers want Interpreters with these core skills. If you want to work as an Interpreter, focus on the following. Go-getter enthusiastic ambitious
While most employers did not require the following skills, multiple job listings included them as preferred. Add these to your Interpreter toolbox and broaden your career options.

Bachelor’s degree in the language being interpreted (Preferred, not required).

Position: Certified Medical Interpreter (Independent Contractor) - All Languages Welcome
Areas of immediate need: Birmingham, Hoover, Alabaster, & Homewood.
Company: MedTrans Go is a tech-enabled brokerage that contracts directly with healthcare facilities to reduce cancellations and missed appointments due to language barriers. MedTrans Go partners with Independent Interpretation Contractors to service these requests. Our web-enabled platform and mobile app enable partners to accept and manage their requests on the go while adding an additional revenue stream. Partners are required to have completed a 40 Hour Medical Language Course and be certified in their language of expertise.
Description/Scope of Position:
Provide over the phone, video, or onsite interpretation service for patients during their medical appointments, including medical procedures, physical therapy, medical consultations, etc.

Job Description:
The Interpreter coordinates and delivers both verbal and written language interpretation for patient, families, and caregivers.
Job Essentials

1. Provides complete and accurate interpretation for patients, families, and facility or hospital staff in order to facilitate communication.
2. Uses communication methods appropriate for patient developmental age and mental condition.
3. Assists patients, families, and staff with sight translation of forms as required and is familiar with most commonly used medical terminology.
4. Demonstrates cultural sensitivity and renders unbiased interpretation to ensure an accurate exchange of information.
5. Adheres to accepted norms of professional ethics and Standards of Practice for Medical Interpreters, as well Intermountain Policies, Title VI, ADA, Section 1557 of the ACA, HIPAA, and Joint Commission requirements.
6. Manages time productively, displaying a proactive approach to the job. Responds to requests (pagers, calls, vocera, etc.) in a timely manner, even when actively interpreting, and provides staff an estimated time of arrival for interpretation assignments. Refers staff to phone or video conferencing interpretation per guidelines.
7. Coordinates interpretation assignments. Keeps timely, accurate records of all interpretation encounters.
8. Uses computer, software, and internet tools for research, data entry, and other communication purposes within the work environment.

Job Title: ASL Interpreter at Fort Belvoir, VA and Fort Meade,MD Needed
Job Description:
We are looking for two FT ASL Interpreters one for Ft. Meade the other for Ft. Belvoir. Basically you will be required to assist with training employees there. Details below:
There are two individuals with one located at Army Military Pay Office (AMPO) Fort (Ft.) Belvoir, Virginia (VA) and the other at AMPO Ft. Meade, Maryland (MD) that need interpretation services for an estimated 4 hours a day, 5 days a week (not to exceed 20 hours a week). Without interpreting services, the hearing-impaired employees are unable to participate in necessary training events and meetings, or receive daily status updates and information essential to performance of their assigned tasks. As a result, they have limited opportunities to cross-train and/or advance in their career fields, and the inability to effectively communicate limits the organization's opportunities to best utilizing hearing-impaired personnel to meet varying workload requirements.
Provide onsite or offsite interpreting service to include interpreting consecutively from:
Interpret oral spoken English into signed English and American Sign Language (ASL).
Interpret Pidgeon sign English (PSE) into oral English.
Interpret Tactile (deaf and blind) into oral English.
Interpret oral English with sign or ASL (in reverse) back into oral English

JOB TITLE: Medical Interpreter-Spanish
DEPARTMENT: Medical Affairs
RESPONSIBLE TO: Chief Medical Officer
EDUCATION: High School Diploma required; Certification preferred
Summary/Objective: Park West Health Systems, a network of Federally Qualified Community Health Centers in northwest Baltimore City, is looking for a fast-thinking and empathetic Medical Interpreter to provide language interpretation and translation services to patients and their families in medical situations when needed.
This role will also perform other clinical administrative duties as needed including but not limited to translating documents, creating documents in Spanish, keeping meeting minutes and other duties as assigned.

Job Description:
The Interpreter coordinates and delivers both verbal and written language interpretation for patient, families, and caregivers.
Job Essentials

1. Provides complete and accurate interpretation for patients, families, and facility or hospital staff in order to facilitate communication.
2. Uses communication methods appropriate for patient developmental age and mental condition.
3. Assists patients, families, and staff with sight translation of forms as required and is familiar with most commonly used medical terminology.
4. Demonstrates cultural sensitivity and renders unbiased interpretation to ensure an accurate exchange of information.
5. Adheres to accepted norms of professional ethics and Standards of Practice for Medical Interpreters, as well Intermountain Policies, Title VI, ADA, Section 1557 of the ACA, HIPAA, and Joint Commission requirements.
6. Manages time productively, displaying a proactive approach to the job. Responds to requests (pagers, calls, vocera, etc.) in a timely manner, even when actively interpreting, and provides staff an estimated time of arrival for interpretation assignments. Refers staff to phone or video conferencing interpretation per guidelines.
7. Coordinates interpretation assignments. Keeps timely, accurate records of all interpretation encounters.
8. Uses computer, software, and internet tools for research, data entry, and other communication purposes within the work environment.
9. May provide translation services from the source language to the target language and vice versa, and completes translation assignments in a timely manner and with a high degree of accuracy.

Interpret oral English with sign or ASL (in reverse) back into oral English

ASL Interpreter for Deaf Professional
Responsibilities
The Interpreter will provide American Sign Language interpreting service for a CESA #1 Deaf professional.
Responsibilities include facilitating communication amongst the Deaf professional, his colleagues, and others in either face-to-face or virtual settings. The Interpreter will also interpret while the employee is providing consultation to families and early intervention teams in support of infants and toddlers who are Deaf/Hard of Hearing.
The Interpreter may also be responsible for scheduling back-up or additional interpreters when necessary, as well as consulting regarding communication considerations for special projects or circumstances. The Interpreter will advocate to other agencies and organizations, when appropriate, regarding the provision of communication access to their sponsored meetings and events.

Company Overview
Fanatics is the global leader in licensed sports merchandise and changing the way fans purchase their favorite team apparel and jerseys. Through an innovative, tech-infused approach to making and selling fan gear in today's on-demand culture, Fanatics operates more than 300 online and offline stores, including the e-commerce business for all major professional sports leagues (NFL, MLB, NBA, NHL, NASCAR, MLS, PGA), and more than 200 collegiate and professional team properties, which include several of the biggest global soccer clubs (Manchester United, Real Madrid, Chelsea). Fanatics offers the largest collection of timeless and timely merchandise whether shopping online, on your phone, in stores, in stadiums, or on-site at the world's biggest sporting events. At Fanatics, we’re a diverse, passionate group of employees aiming to ignite pride and passion in the fans we outfit, celebrate and support. We recognize that diversity helps drive and foster innovation, and through our IDEA program (inclusion, diversity, equality, and advocacy) at Fanatics, we provide employees with tools and resources to feel connected and engaged in who they are and what they do to support the ultimate fan experience.

Job Description:
The Interpreter coordinates and delivers both verbal and written language interpretation for patient, families, and caregivers.
Job Essentials

1. Provides complete and accurate interpretation for patients, families, and facility or hospital staff in order to facilitate communication.
2. Uses communication methods appropriate for patient developmental age and mental condition.
3. Assists patients, families, and staff with sight translation of forms as required and is familiar with most commonly used medical terminology.
4. Demonstrates cultural sensitivity and renders unbiased interpretation to ensure an accurate exchange of information.
5. Adheres to accepted norms of professional ethics and Standards of Practice for Medical Interpreters, as well Intermountain Policies, Title VI, ADA, Section 1557 of the ACA, HIPAA, and Joint Commission requirements.
6. Manages time productively, displaying a proactive approach to the job. Responds to requests (pagers, calls, vocera, etc.) in a timely manner, even when actively interpreting, and provides staff an estimated time of arrival for interpretation assignments. Refers staff to phone or video conferencing interpretation per guidelines.
7. Coordinates interpretation assignments. Keeps timely, accurate records of all interpretation encounters.
8. Uses computer, software, and internet tools for research, data entry, and other communication purposes within the work environment.
9. May provide translation services from the source language to the target language and vice versa, and completes translation assignments in a timely manner and with a high degree of accuracy.

If interested, please submit your resume, any credentials or certifications you may have, and any other information you'd like us to consider. Please include your asking pay rate.
A majority of interpreting work would include educational (K-12 or community college) or medical. There may be occasional work outside of those genres but SLUSA would never assign an interpreter to something they are unqualified or uncomfortable with.
All qualified candidates will be contacted for discussion.

Job Description: Work at Home Bilingual English/Spanish Language Phone Interpreter
Job Title: Telephone Interpreter
Location: Work at Home position in Nevada
Position: Contract Position Long Term
**This is a remote position. The Interpreter works from his/her home-office. It is essential to ensure a quiet & secure environment.**
Position Overview:
The Telephone Interpreter is responsible for handling calls on demand and renders the
meaning of conversations between required language and English speakers. The interpreter
breaks the communication barrier in a wide range of industries including: Healthcare,
Government, Insurance, Financial, Utilities, Travel & Hospitality, General Business, Law Enforcement, Court, and 911. The interpreter processes information quickly, concisely and recognizes sensitive
cultural differences. He/She is always professional and courteous . The interpreter uses
appropriate terminology and understands common industry procedures and practices. The
calls may involve simple or complex, technical, or non-technical subjects. Telephone
interpreters translate verbally.

Job Title: ASL Interpreter at Fort Belvoir, VA and Fort Meade,MD Needed
Job Description:
We are looking for two FT ASL Interpreters one for Ft. Meade the other for Ft. Belvoir. Basically you will be required to assist with training employees there. Details below:
There are two individuals with one located at Army Military Pay Office (AMPO) Fort (Ft.) Belvoir, Virginia (VA) and the other at AMPO Ft. Meade, Maryland (MD) that need interpretation services for an estimated 4 hours a day, 5 days a week (not to exceed 20 hours a week). Without interpreting services, the hearing-impaired employees are unable to participate in necessary training events and meetings, or receive daily status updates and information essential to performance of their assigned tasks. As a result, they have limited opportunities to cross-train and/or advance in their career fields, and the inability to effectively communicate limits the organization's opportunities to best utilizing hearing-impaired personnel to meet varying workload requirements.
Provide onsite or offsite interpreting service to include interpreting consecutively from:
Interpret oral spoken English into signed English and American Sign Language (ASL).
Interpret Pidgeon sign English (PSE) into oral English.
Interpret Tactile (deaf and blind) into oral English.
Interpret oral English with sign or ASL (in reverse) back into oral English

Analytic Linguist – A position with a purpose!
Metlang is seeking exceptional bilingual professionals looking to enhance their analytical and translation skills. Are you a people person? Are you looking to provide a much needed public service to our community? Are you looking to put your bilingual skills to use while getting paid for your abilities and experience?
Metlang is a veteran owned provider of interpretation, translation, and monitoring services to the law enforcement community nationwide. Since 1990, Metlang has been the nation’s leading provider of interpretation, translation, and monitoring services to the United States Department of Justice nationwide. We employ experienced bilingual professionals with advanced or expert level foreign language fluency in over 100 languages and dialects.
Analytic Linguists are responsible for monitoring, transcribing, translating, interpreting and analyzing source material assisting law enforcement with their investigations into narco-trafficking, counterfeiting, terrorism, fraud and money laundering. Metlang offers rewarding part-time and full-time project based employment on-site. We take pride in building long term relationships with our employees while providing outstanding benefits and competitive weekly pay.

Fanatics is the global leader in licensed sports merchandise and changing the way fans purchase their favorite team apparel and jerseys. Through an innovative, tech-infused approach to making and selling fan gear in today's on-demand culture, Fanatics operates more than 300 online and offline stores, including the e-commerce business for all major professional sports leagues (NFL, MLB, NBA, NHL, NASCAR, MLS, PGA), and more than 200 collegiate and professional team properties, which include several of the biggest global soccer clubs (Manchester United, Real Madrid, Chelsea). Fanatics offers the largest collection of timeless and timely merchandise whether shopping online, on your phone, in stores, in stadiums, or on-site at the world's biggest sporting events. At Fanatics, we’re a diverse, passionate group of employees aiming to ignite pride and passion in the fans we outfit, celebrate and support. We recognize that diversity helps drive and foster innovation, and through our IDEA program (inclusion, diversity, equality, and advocacy) at Fanatics, we provide employees with tools and resources to feel connected and engaged in who they are and what they do to support the ultimate fan experience.

Provides interpretation support to the business by coordinating medical services for patients via telephone/video and/or Internet (e.g. instant message, email). Sign Language USA (SLUSA) is currently looking for full time guaranteed hour interpreters to join our team. Exact number of guaranteed hours is flexible but generally we will consider between 15 and 30 hours per week (more if desired).
SLUSA will pay out a salary every two weeks on the 1st and 15th of every month.
If interested, please submit your resume, any credentials or certifications you may have, and any other information you'd like us to consider. Please include your asking pay rate.

All qualified candidates will be contacted for discussion.

Job Title: ASL Interpreter at Fort Belvoir, VA and Fort Meade,MD Needed
Job Description:
We are looking for two FT ASL Interpreters one for Ft. Meade the other for Ft. Belvoir. Basically you will be required to assist with training employees there. Details below:
There are two individuals with one located at Army Military Pay Office (AMPO) Fort (Ft.) Belvoir, Virginia (VA) and the other at AMPO Ft. Meade, Maryland (MD) that need interpretation services for an estimated 4 hours a day, 5 days a week (not to exceed 20 hours a week). Without interpreting services, the hearing-impaired employees are unable to participate in necessary training events and meetings, or receive daily status updates and information essential to performance of their assigned tasks. As a result, they have limited opportunities to cross-train and/or advance in their career fields, and the inability to effectively communicate limits the organization's opportunities to best utilizing hearing-impaired personnel to meet varying workload requirements.
Provide onsite or offsite interpreting service to include interpreting consecutively from:
Interpret oral spoken English into signed English and American Sign Language (ASL).
Interpret Pidgeon sign English (PSE) into oral English.
Interpret Tactile (deaf and blind) into oral English.
Interpret oral English with sign or ASL (in reverse) back into oral English

Job Description:
The Interpreter coordinates and delivers both verbal and written language interpretation for patient, families, and caregivers.
Job Essentials

1. Provides complete and accurate interpretation for patients, families, and facility or hospital staff in order to facilitate communication.
2. Uses communication methods appropriate for patient developmental age and mental condition.
3. Assists patients, families, and staff with sight translation of forms as required and is familiar with most commonly used medical terminology.
4. Demonstrates cultural sensitivity and renders unbiased interpretation to ensure an accurate exchange of information.
5. Adheres to accepted norms of professional ethics and Standards of Practice for Medical Interpreters, as well Intermountain Policies, Title VI, ADA, Section 1557 of the ACA, HIPAA, and Joint Commission requirements.
6. Manages time productively, displaying a proactive approach to the job. Responds to requests (pagers, calls, vocera, etc.) in a timely manner, even when actively interpreting, and provides staff an estimated time of arrival for interpretation assignments. Refers staff to phone or video conferencing interpretation per guidelines.
7. Coordinates interpretation assignments. Keeps timely, accurate records of all interpretation encounters.
8. Uses computer, software, and internet tools for research, data entry, and other communication purposes within the work environment.
9. May provide translation services from the source language to the target language and vice versa, and completes translation assignments in a timely manner and with a high degree of accuracy.

Sign Language USA (SLUSA) is currently looking for full time guaranteed hour interpreters to join our team. Exact number of guaranteed hours is flexible but generally we will consider between 15 and 30 hours per week (more if desired).
SLUSA will pay out a salary every two weeks on the 1st and 15th of every month.
If interested, please submit your resume, any credentials or certifications you may have, and any other information you'd like us to consider. Please include your asking pay rate.
A majority of interpreting work would include educational (K-12 or community college) or medical. There may be occasional work outside of those genres but SLUSA would never assign an interpreter to something they are unqualified or uncomfortable with.
All qualified candidates will be contacted for discussion.

Company Overview
Fanatics is the global leader in licensed sports merchandise and changing the way fans purchase their favorite team apparel and jerseys. Through an innovative, tech-infused approach to making and selling fan gear in today's on-demand culture, Fanatics operates more than 300 online and offline stores, including the e-commerce business for all major professional sports leagues (NFL, MLB, NBA, NHL, NASCAR, MLS, PGA), and more than 200 collegiate and professional team properties, which include several of the biggest global soccer clubs (Manchester United, Real Madrid, Chelsea). Fanatics offers the largest collection of timeless and timely merchandise whether shopping online, on your phone, in stores, in stadiums, or on-site at the world's biggest sporting events. At Fanatics, we’re a diverse, passionate group of employees aiming to ignite pride and passion in the fans we outfit, celebrate and support. We recognize that diversity helps drive and foster innovation, and through our IDEA program (inclusion, diversity, equality, and advocacy) at Fanatics, we provide employees with tools and resources to feel connected and engaged in who they are and what they do to support the ultimate fan experience.

Job Title: ASL Interpreter at Fort Belvoir, VA and Fort Meade,MD Needed
Job Description:
We are looking for two FT ASL Interpreters one for Ft. Meade the other for Ft. Belvoir. Basically you will be required to assist with training employees there. Details below:
There are two individuals with one located at Army Military Pay Office (AMPO) Fort (Ft.) Belvoir, Virginia (VA) and the other at AMPO Ft. Meade, Maryland (MD) that need interpretation services for an estimated 4 hours a day, 5 days a week (not to exceed 20 hours a week). Without interpreting services, the hearing-impaired employees are unable to participate in necessary training events and meetings, or receive daily status updates and information essential to performance of their assigned tasks. As a result, they have limited opportunities to cross-train and/or advance in their career fields, and the inability to effectively communicate limits the organization's opportunities to best utilizing hearing-impaired personnel to meet varying workload requirements.
Provide onsite or offsite interpreting service to include interpreting consecutively from:
Interpret oral spoken English into signed English and American Sign Language (ASL).
Interpret Pidgeon sign English (PSE) into oral English.
Interpret Tactile (deaf and blind) into oral English.
Interpret oral English with sign or ASL (in reverse) back into oral English

Job Title: ASL Interpreter at Fort Belvoir, VA and Fort Meade,MD Needed
Job Description:
We are looking for two FT ASL Interpreters one for Ft. Meade the other for Ft. Belvoir. Basically you will be required to assist with training employees there. Details below:
There are two individuals with one located at Army Military Pay Office (AMPO) Fort (Ft.) Belvoir, Virginia (VA) and the other at AMPO Ft. Meade, Maryland (MD) that need interpretation services for an estimated 4 hours a day, 5 days a week (not to exceed 20 hours a week). Without interpreting services, the hearing-impaired employees are unable to participate in necessary training events and meetings, or receive daily status updates and information essential to performance of their assigned tasks. As a result, they have limited opportunities to cross-train and/or advance in their career fields, and the inability to effectively communicate limits the organization's opportunities to best utilizing hearing-impaired personnel to meet varying workload requirements.
Provide onsite or offsite interpreting service to include interpreting consecutively from:
Interpret oral spoken English into signed English and American Sign Language (ASL).
Interpret Pidgeon sign English (PSE) into oral English.
Interpret Tactile (deaf and blind) into oral English.
Interpret oral English with sign or ASL (in reverse) back into oral English

LanguageLine Solutions is Hiring!
At LanguageLine, we strive for a world in which language and cultural barriers no longer exist. Use your language skills to dramatically improve the lives of limited-English speakers, as well as the Deaf and Hard-of-Hearing. Even better, you can do this while working from your own home.
LanguageLine has been certified as a Great Place to Work, and is regularly listed as one of America’s top work-from-home employers.
Our interpreters serve clients across numerous industries, including health care, 911, first responders, education, government agencies, and all walks of business.

We provide numerous opportunities for advancement. You’ll be in a certified ASTM and ISO environment. You'll also be supported by a Senior Language Specialist, as well as our Interpreter and Technology Help Desks.

Job Title: ASL Interpreter at Fort Belvoir, VA and Fort Meade,MD Needed
Job Description:
We are looking for two FT ASL Interpreters one for Ft. Meade the other for Ft. Belvoir. Basically you will be required to assist with training employees there. Details below:
There are two individuals with one located at Army Military Pay Office (AMPO) Fort (Ft.) Belvoir, Virginia (VA) and the other at AMPO Ft. Meade, Maryland (MD) that need interpretation services for an estimated 4 hours a day, 5 days a week (not to exceed 20 hours a week). Without interpreting services, the hearing-impaired employees are unable to participate in necessary training events and meetings, or receive daily status updates and information essential to performance of their assigned tasks. As a result, they have limited opportunities to cross-train and/or advance in their career fields, and the inability to effectively communicate limits the organization's opportunities to best utilizing hearing-impaired personnel to meet varying workload requirements.
Provide onsite or offsite interpreting service to include interpreting consecutively from:
Interpret oral spoken English into signed English and American Sign Language (ASL).
Interpret Pidgeon sign English (PSE) into oral English.
Interpret Tactile (deaf and blind) into oral English.
Interpret oral English with sign or ASL (in reverse) back into oral English

LanguageLine Solutions is Hiring!
At LanguageLine, we strive for a world in which language and cultural barriers no longer exist. Use your language skills to dramatically improve the lives of limited-English speakers, as well as the Deaf and Hard-of-Hearing. Even better, you can do this while working from your own home.
LanguageLine has been certified as a Great Place to Work, and is regularly listed as one of America’s top work-from-home employers.
Our interpreters serve clients across numerous industries, including health care, 911, first responders, education, government agencies, and all walks of business.
As an interpreter, you will receive training that is the best in the industry. We’ll ensure that you learn new skills while further developing your skillset. We provide numerous opportunities for advancement. You’ll be in a certified ASTM and ISO environment. You'll also be supported by a Senior Language Specialist, as well as our Interpreter and Technology Help Desks.

Job Title: Freelance English to Khmer Subtitle Translator
Job Description:
Iyuno-SDI Group is a global entertainment technology and localization company serving the world's leading entertainment studios in dubbing, subtitling and media services with 67 offices across 34 countries. We provide end-to-end global media services that enhance global storytelling through expert fluency, a seamless and secure experience and connected network. A technology trailblazer with grounded core values centered around quality and simplicity in an ever-changing industry. Using its sophisticated in-house technology for all product and service offerings. With over 35 million subtitles and 10 million dubbed minutes of content in 100+ languages, Iyuno-SDI Group is focused on connecting people and connecting content to the world. If content localization and entertainment are your passion, then this may be the job for you. We would like to welcome you to join us while we grow to connect video and people. To find out more about Iyuno-SDI Group, please visit our official website at https://www.iyunomg.com/.

Sign Language USA (SLUSA) is currently looking for full time guaranteed hour interpreters to join our team. Exact number of guaranteed hours is flexible but generally we will consider between 15 and 30 hours per week (more if desired).
SLUSA will pay out a salary every two weeks on the 1st and 15th of every month.
If interested, please submit your resume, any credentials or certifications you may have, and any other information you'd like us to consider. Please include your asking pay rate.
A majority of interpreting work would include educational (K-12 or community college) or medical. There may be occasional work outside of those genres but SLUSA would never assign an interpreter to something they are unqualified or uncomfortable with.
All qualified candidates will be contacted for discussion.

Job Title: ASL Interpreter at Fort Belvoir, VA and Fort Meade,MD Needed
Job Description:
We are looking for two FT ASL Interpreters one for Ft. Meade the other for Ft. Belvoir. Basically you will be required to assist with training employees there. Details below:
There are two individuals with one located at Army Military Pay Office (AMPO) Fort (Ft.) Belvoir, Virginia (VA) and the other at AMPO Ft. Meade, Maryland (MD) that need interpretation services for an estimated 4 hours a day, 5 days a week (not to exceed 20 hours a week). Without interpreting services, the hearing-impaired employees are unable to participate in necessary training events and meetings, or receive daily status updates and information essential to performance of their assigned tasks. As a result, they have limited opportunities to cross-train and/or advance in their career fields, and the inability to effectively communicate limits the organization's opportunities to best utilizing hearing-impaired personnel to meet varying workload requirements.
Provide onsite or offsite interpreting service to include interpreting consecutively from:
Interpret oral spoken English into signed English and American Sign Language (ASL).
Interpret Pidgeon sign English (PSE) into oral English.
Interpret Tactile (deaf and blind) into oral English.
Interpret oral English with sign or ASL (in reverse) back into oral English

In addition, the Medical Interpreter will address and resolve simple to complex inquiries and issues with customers and patients. Performs other administrative duties as requested.
GENERAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
Serves as primary contact to provide Spanish interpretation for the coordination of medical services and patient issues.

Our employees interpret for several industries, such as healthcare, finance, insurance, 9-1-1, and business, so every call often feels like a new and different experience.
Qualifications

Translation Workflow Support Specialist (Part-time)
ManpowerGroup Public Sector (MGPS) provides foreign language project solutions and linguist staffing support to multiple Government clients. Language services cover 175 languages and span translation, interpretation, transcription, desktop publishing, cleared linguist staffing, voiceover and subtitling/captioning, multimedia and web localization, and human language technology, among others. We have an immediate opening for a Translation Workflow Support Specialist to support a government contract for our Government Language Solutions team.
The Translation Workflow Support Specialist (WSS) in ManpowerGroup Public Sector’s Government Language Solutions (GLS) Department provides day-to-day operational and technology-based support to translation team members, perform troubleshooting tasks, automate workflow schemes by creating templates and utilizing technology, document and standardize work processes, improve effectiveness, manage and maintain translation memories and databases, and assist with various tasking and management duties.

TransPerfect Is More Than Just a Job…

TransPerfect Connect (TPC) is looking for Mandarin bilinguals at all levels with demonstrated experience utilizing their bilingual skills in a professional setting. We will train you to start your career path as an Over the Phone Interpreter.
Candidates must be fluent in Mandarin < > English and aspire to be a fantastic advocate for our end clients, utilizing their new learned talents to deliver superior consecutive interpretations. So, whether you’re helping a patient communicate with their doctor, or assisting a family get a loan with a bank, we want someone who is excited about using their language abilities to help others.

Qualifications

Sign Language USA (SLUSA) is currently looking for full time guaranteed hour interpreters to join our team. Exact number of guaranteed hours is flexible but generally we will consider between 15 and 30 hours per week (more if desired).
SLUSA will pay out a salary every two weeks on the 1st and 15th of every month.
If interested, please submit your resume, any credentials or certifications you may have, and any other information you'd like us to consider. Please include your asking pay rate.
A majority of interpreting work would include educational (K-12 or community college) or medical. There may be occasional work outside of those genres but SLUSA would never assign an interpreter to something they are unqualified or uncomfortable with.
All qualified candidates will be contacted for discussion.

EDUCATION: High School Diploma required; Certification preferred
Summary/Objective: Park West Health Systems, a network of Federally Qualified Community Health Centers in northwest Baltimore City, is looking for a fast-thinking and empathetic Medical Interpreter to provide language interpretation and translation services to patients and their families in medical situations when needed.

Job Title: Freelance English to Khmer Subtitle Translator
Job Description:
Iyuno-SDI Group is a global entertainment technology and localization company serving the world's leading entertainment studios in dubbing, subtitling and media services with 67 offices across 34 countries. We provide end-to-end global media services that enhance global storytelling through expert fluency, a seamless and secure experience and connected network. A technology trailblazer with grounded core values centered around quality and simplicity in an ever-changing industry. Using its sophisticated in-house technology for all product and service offerings. With over 35 million subtitles and 10 million dubbed minutes of content in 100+ languages, Iyuno-SDI Group is focused on connecting people and connecting content to the world. If content localization and entertainment are your passion, then this may be the job for you. We would like to welcome you to join us while we grow to connect video and people. To find out more about Iyuno-SDI Group, please visit our official website at https://www.iyunomg.com/.

At LanguageLine, we strive for a world in which language and cultural barriers no longer exist. Use your language skills to dramatically improve the lives of limited-English speakers, as well as the Deaf and Hard-of-Hearing. Even better, you can do this while working from your own home.

**This is a remote position. The Interpreter works from his/her home-office. It is essential to ensure a quiet & secure environment.**

The Telephone Interpreter is responsible for handling calls on demand and renders the
meaning of conversations between required language and English speakers. The interpreter
breaks the communication barrier in a wide range of industries including: Healthcare,

cultural differences. He/She is always professional and courteous . The interpreter uses
appropriate terminology and understands common industry procedures and practices. The
calls may involve simple or complex, technical, or non-technical subjects. Telephone
interpreters translate verbally.

LanguageLine Solutions is Hiring!
At LanguageLine, we strive for a world in which language and cultural barriers no longer exist. Use your language skills to dramatically improve the lives of limited-English speakers, as well as the Deaf and Hard-of-Hearing. Even better, you can do this while working from your own home.
LanguageLine has been certified as a Great Place to Work, and is regularly listed as one of America’s top work-from-home employers.
Our interpreters serve clients across numerous industries, including health care, 911, first responders, education, government agencies, and all walks of business.
As an interpreter, you will receive training that is the best in the industry. We’ll ensure that you learn new skills while further developing your skillset. We provide numerous opportunities for advancement. You’ll be in a certified ASTM and ISO environment. You'll also be supported by a Senior Language Specialist, as well as our Interpreter and Technology Help Desks.

Job Title: Freelance English to Khmer Subtitle Translator

Iyuno-SDI Group is a global entertainment technology and localization company serving the world's leading entertainment studios in dubbing, subtitling and media services with 67 offices across 34 countries. We provide end-to-end global media services that enhance global storytelling through expert fluency, a seamless and secure experience and connected network. A technology trailblazer with grounded core values centered around quality and simplicity in an ever-changing industry. Using its sophisticated in-house technology for all product and service offerings. If content localization and entertainment are your passion, then this may be the job for you. We would like to welcome you to join us while we grow to connect video and people. JOB TITLE: Medical Interpreter-Spanish
DEPARTMENT: Medical Affairs
RESPONSIBLE TO: Chief Medical Officer
EDUCATION: High School Diploma required; Certification preferred
Summary/Objective: Park West Health Systems, a network of Federally Qualified Community Health Centers in northwest Baltimore City, is looking for a fast-thinking and empathetic Medical Interpreter to provide language interpretation and translation services to patients and their families in medical situations when needed.
This role will also perform other clinical administrative duties as needed including but not limited to translating documents, creating documents in Spanish, keeping meeting minutes and other duties as assigned.

Position: Certified Medical Interpreter (Independent Contractor) - All Languages Welcome
Areas of immediate need: Birmingham, Hoover, Alabaster, & Homewood.
Company: MedTrans Go is a tech-enabled brokerage that contracts directly with healthcare facilities to reduce cancellations and missed appointments due to language barriers. MedTrans Go partners with Independent Interpretation Contractors to service these requests. Our web-enabled platform and mobile app enable partners to accept and manage their requests on the go while adding an additional revenue stream. Partners are required to have completed a 40 Hour Medical Language Course and be certified in their language of expertise.
Description/Scope of Position:
Provide over the phone, video, or onsite interpretation service for patients during their medical appointments, including medical procedures, physical therapy, medical consultations, etc.

Spanish Telephonic Medical Interpreter

Provides interpretation support to the business by coordinating medical services for patients via telephone/video and/or Internet (e.g. instant message, email). Coordinating medical services includes (as examples): completing intake of customer referral, ordering medical equipment, medical supplies, scheduling appointments, and managing visits. In addition, the Medical Interpreter will address and resolve simple to complex inquiries and issues with customers and patients. Performs other administrative duties as requested.
GENERAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
Serves as primary contact to provide Spanish interpretation for the coordination of medical services and patient issues.

state date as soon as 2 week

Nepali- English Interpreter/Translator is an independent contractor, work-from-home position. The Remote Interpreter/Translator would be responsible for servicing video interpretation and phone interpretation appointments on an as-needed basis. The contractor may also be asked to complete document translations, proofreading and/or formatting on an as-needed basis and may be asked to do language assessments of other Nepali speakers as well. A good understanding of Microsoft Word is preferred.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
- Video Interpretation: interpreting verbal Nepali < -> verbal English via our online video interpretation system (previous interpretation experience preferred, however we will provide on-the-job training)
- Phone Interpretation: interpreting verbal Nepali < -> verbal English via contractor's personal phone (previous interpretation experience preferred, however we will provide on-the-job training)

LanguageLine Solutions is Hiring!
At LanguageLine, we strive for a world in which language and cultural barriers no longer exist. Use your language skills to dramatically improve the lives of limited-English speakers, as well as the Deaf and Hard-of-Hearing. Even better, you can do this while working from your own home.
LanguageLine has been certified as a Great Place to Work, and is regularly listed as one of America’s top work-from-home employers.
Our interpreters serve clients across numerous industries, including health care, 911, first responders, education, government agencies, and all walks of business.
As an interpreter, you will receive training that is the best in the industry. We’ll ensure that you learn new skills while further developing your skillset. We provide numerous opportunities for advancement. You’ll be in a certified ASTM and ISO environment. You'll also be supported by a Senior Language Specialist, as well as our Interpreter and Technology Help Desks.

Job Description: Work at Home Bilingual English/Spanish Language Phone Interpreter
Job Title: Telephone Interpreter
Location: Work at Home position in Nevada
Position: Contract Position Long Term
**This is a remote position. The Interpreter works from his/her home-office. It is essential to ensure a quiet & secure environment.**
Position Overview:
The Telephone Interpreter is responsible for handling calls on demand and renders the
meaning of conversations between required language and English speakers. The interpreter
breaks the communication barrier in a wide range of industries including: Healthcare,
Government, Insurance, Financial, Utilities, Travel & Hospitality, General Business, Law Enforcement, Court, and 911. The interpreter processes information quickly, concisely and recognizes sensitive
cultural differences. He/She is always professional and courteous . The interpreter uses
appropriate terminology and understands common industry procedures and practices. The
calls may involve simple or complex, technical, or non-technical subjects. Telephone
interpreters translate verbally.

Nepali- English Interpreter/Translator is an independent contractor, work-from-home position. The Remote Interpreter/Translator would be responsible for servicing video interpretation and phone interpretation appointments on an as-needed basis. The contractor may also be asked to complete document translations, proofreading and/or formatting on an as-needed basis and may be asked to do language assessments of other Nepali speakers as well. A good understanding of Microsoft Word is preferred.

- Video Interpretation: interpreting verbal Nepali < -> verbal English via our online video interpretation system (previous interpretation experience preferred, however we will provide on-the-job training)
- Phone Interpretation: interpreting verbal Nepali < -> verbal English via contractor's personal phone (previous interpretation experience preferred, however we will provide on-the-job training)

LanguageLine Solutions is Hiring!
At LanguageLine, we strive for a world in which language and cultural barriers no longer exist. Use your language skills to dramatically improve the lives of limited-English speakers, as well as the Deaf and Hard-of-Hearing. Even better, you can do this while working from your own home.
LanguageLine has been certified as a Great Place to Work, and is regularly listed as one of America’s top work-from-home employers.
Our interpreters serve clients across numerous industries, including health care, 911, first responders, education, government agencies, and all walks of business.
As an interpreter, you will receive training that is the best in the industry. We’ll ensure that you learn new skills while further developing your skillset. We provide numerous opportunities for advancement. You’ll be in a certified ASTM and ISO environment. You'll also be supported by a Senior Language Specialist, as well as our Interpreter and Technology Help Desks.
